title: Emotional Intelligence Through Artificial Intelligence: NLP and Deep Learning in the Analysis of Healthcare Texts
text: This manuscript presents a methodical examination of the utilization of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the assessment of emotions in texts related to healthcare, with a particular focus on the incorporation of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and deep learning technologies. We scrutinize numerous research studies that employ AI to augment sentiment analysis, categorize emotions, and forecast patient outcomes based on textual information derived from clinical narratives, patient feedback on medications, and online health discussions. The review demonstrates noteworthy progress in the precision of algorithms used for sentiment classification, the prognostic capabilities of AI models for neurodegenerative diseases, and the creation of AI-powered systems that offer support in clinical decision-making. Remarkably, the utilization of AI applications has exhibited an enhancement in personalized therapy plans by integrating patient sentiment and contributing to the early identification of mental health disorders. There persist challenges, which encompass ensuring the ethical application of AI, safeguarding patient confidentiality, and addressing potential biases in algorithmic procedures. Nevertheless, the potential of AI to revolutionize healthcare practices is unmistakable, offering a future where healthcare is not only more knowledgeable and efficient but also more empathetic and centered around the needs of patients. This investigation underscores the transformative influence of AI on healthcare, delivering a comprehensive comprehension of its role in examining emotional content in healthcare texts and highlighting the trajectory towards a more compassionate approach to patient care. The findings advocate for a harmonious synergy between AI’s analytical capabilities and the human aspects of healthcare, guaranteeing that technological advancements are aligned with the emotional well-being of patients.

Advancing Patient Care through Text Data: A Systematic Review of AI, Emotional Analysis, and Patient-Centric Applications in Healthcare
text: This systematic review explores how text data can advance patient care through artificial intelligence, emotional analysis, and patient-centric applications in healthcare settings.

title: Expanding AI’s Role in Healthcare Applications: A Systematic Review of Emotional and Cognitive Analysis Techniques
text: This systematic literature review (SLR) analyzes the various applications of artificial intelligence (AI) in healthcare, with a particular emphasis on the integration of emotive and cognitive analytical frameworks. The primary aim of this investigation is to thoroughly evaluate the influence of AI technology on patient care by analyzing emotional processes and enabling patient-centered solutions.

title: Yolov5-Based Attention Mechanism for Gesture Recognition in Complex Environment
text: This paper proposes a Yolov5-based attention mechanism for gesture recognition in complex environments. The algorithm addresses challenges in gesture detection including varying scales, occlusions, and complex backgrounds. By incorporating attention mechanisms, the model improves feature extraction and recognition accuracy.

title: Yolov5-Based Attention Mechanism for Gesture Recognition in Complex Environment
text: This paper proposes a Yolov5-based attention mechanism for gesture recognition in complex environments. The algorithm addresses challenges in gesture detection including varying scales, occlusions, and complex backgrounds. By incorporating attention mechanisms, the model improves feature extraction and recognition accuracy.

title: Contextual BI-Directional Attention Flow With Embeddings From Language Models: A Generative Approach to Emotion Detection
text: Detection of Emotions from the text is a tedious task. Presently, existing models failed to detect the emotion in absence of the emotional word in the text. The cause phrase selection which gives a deep insight into emotions is considered to be a tough task. The proposed model for detecting emotions is developed through seven layers. Initially, the dataset is represented in the Topical documents using Adversarial Topic Modelling (ATM). Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) maps each phrase in the topical document to Higher-dimensional vectors, followed by the ELMo Model to obtain the fixed word Embeddings vectors. LSTM is responsible for making the interaction between the words in word embeddings and produces the context and query vectors. The bi-directional Attention flow layer determines the most relevant similarity between Context and Query. Finally, Robustly Optimized BERT (RoBERT) architecture is used to detect the Emotion. It is noted that the proposed multi-stage model detects better emotions than all the existing state-of-art models for detecting emotions.

title: Prashant Kumar Nag
text: I am an early-career researcher specializing in artificial intelligence, deep learning, and affective computing, with a particular focus on emotion detection, cognitive appraisal, and explainable AI. My work explores how AI models interpret human emotions in text and how transparent analytical methods can improve understanding, reliability, and human-centered applications. I am committed to developing rigorous, reproducible, and interpretable AI techniques while contributing to research, teaching, and collaborative academic growth.

title: Software Suite
text: In the digital age where tools shape the way we think and work, my software choices reflect precision, curiosity, and a focus on reproducible research. Every project I undertake is supported by a curated suite of tools that accelerate productivity and improve reliability. This page documents the ecosystem that powers my research, development, writing, teaching, and content creation.

title: Software Suite
text:
Deep Learning Frameworks

PyTorch – Primary framework for deep learning research and model development.
TensorFlow – Alternative framework for machine learning projects.
PyTorch Lightning – High-level framework for structured, scalable training on top of PyTorch.
Hugging Face Transformers – Library for state-of-the-art transformer-based NLP models.

title: Software Suite
text:
Python Ecosystem

Python 3.x – Core programming language for ML, scripting, and automation.
Jupyter Notebook – Interactive computational environment for experiments and prototypes.
Google Colab – Cloud-based environment for Python and GPU-accelerated ML.

title: Software Suite
text:
Experiment Configuration & Versioning

Hydra – Configuration framework for managing complex experiment setups.
Data Version Control (DVC) – Data version control and pipeline automation for ML projects.
TensorBoard – Visualization toolkit for training metrics and model graphs.

title: Software Suite
text:
Code Editors & IDEs

Visual Studio Code (VS Code) – Primary editor for coding, writing, and note-taking.
RStudio – Integrated development environment for R.
Doom Emacs – Highly configurable Emacs configuration for advanced text editing.
Notepad++ – Lightweight editor for quick text editing on Windows.

title: Software Suite
text:
Environment & Project Management

Conda / Micromamba – Environment and package management for Python and data science.
Lightning-Hydra Template – Structured ML project template combining PyTorch Lightning, Hydra, and best practices.

title: Software Suite
text:
Terminal & Shell

Windows Terminal – Modern terminal solution on Windows.
PowerShell – Scripting and task automation on Windows.
Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL2) – Linux environment on Windows, primarily using Ubuntu.

title: Software Suite
text:
Literature Management

Zotero + BetterBibTeX – Reference management, citation keys, and BibTeX/CSL JSON export.
Google Scholar – Literature search and citation tracking.
ORCID, Scopus, ResearchGate – Researcher profiles and academic networking.

title: Software Suite
text:
Document Preparation

Quarto – Primary tool for presentations, reports, thesis chapters, and documentation.
LaTeX – Typesetting for technical documents, including custom classes like ManitThesis.cls and MANIT Lab Manual.
Pandoc – Universal document converter behind many of my workflows.
Markdown – Lightweight markup language for notes and documentation.
TinyTeX / pdflatex – Minimal TeX distribution and PDF generation tooling.

title: Software Suite
text:
Writing & Note-Taking

VS Code – Primary environment for writing Quarto/Markdown documents.
Obsidian – Knowledge management and personal note-taking using Markdown.

title: Software Suite
text:
Diagramming & Graphics for Papers

TikZ/PGF – LaTeX-based diagrams for high-quality figures.
Mermaid – Text-based diagrams and flowcharts embedded in Markdown/Quarto.
draw.io (diagrams.net) – Browser-based diagramming tool.
Inkscape – Vector graphics editor for technical diagrams and figures.

title: Software Suite
text:
Core R Stack

R – Statistical computing and data analysis.
tidyverse – Collection of R packages (e.g., dplyr, ggplot2, tidyr, purrr) for data science.
rmarkdown – Dynamic documents using R and Markdown.
pagedown – HTML-based paged documents, including academic CVs.

title: Software Suite
text:
Typical Use Cases

Automation for Systematic Literature Reviews (SLRs).
CV generation via an Excel → R → pagedown pipeline.
Statistical analysis, visualization, and reproducible reports.

title: Software Suite
text:
Data Visualization Libraries

Matplotlib – Core plotting library for Python.
Seaborn – Statistical data visualization built on top of Matplotlib.
ggplot2 – Grammar of graphics implementation in R.
Plotly – Interactive graphing library for Python and R.
Tableau – Business intelligence and dashboarding.

title: Software Suite
text:
Image & Design Tools

GIMP – Raster graphics and photo editing.
LibreOffice Draw – Diagrams and sketches.
Microsoft PowerPoint – Slide design and visual content creation.

title: Software Suite
text:
Cluster & Remote Computing

Portable Batch System (PBS) – Job scheduling on HPC clusters using commands like qsub and qstat.
SSH / SCP – Remote server access and secure file transfer from the terminal.

title: Software Suite
text:
Monitoring & Hardware Tools

htop – Interactive process and resource monitor in terminal.
nvidia-smi – GPU monitoring and management for NVIDIA GPUs.

title: Software Suite
text:
System & Configuration Management

Windows Package Manager (winget) – Package manager for installing and updating software on Windows.
chezmoi – Cross-machine dotfiles management for consistent development environments.

title: Software Suite
text:
Productivity & Everyday Tools

Raindrop.io – Bookmark and web resource manager.
Microsoft Edge – Primary web browser.
Espanso – Cross-platform text expansion.
Slack / Microsoft Teams – Communication and collaboration platforms.

title: Software Suite
text:
Cloud Storage

Google Drive – Cloud storage, backup, and file sharing.

title: Software Suite
text:
Video & Screen Content

OBS Studio – Screen recording and live streaming.
Shotcut – Open-source video editor.
YouTube Studio – Channel and content management for my ResearchInfuser YouTube channel.

title: Software Suite
text:
Quarto Extensions







MANIT Thesis Quarto Extension (manit-thesis)
Quarto extension that applies MANIT-approved thesis formatting through a reusable template for fully reproducible dissertation authoring. Supports LaTeX, R, and Pandoc for professional academic document generation.
GitHub Repository









MANIT Pre-Thesis Quarto Extension (manit-pre-thesis)
Quarto document template for Pre-PhD pre-thesis formatting with automated LaTeX styling, compliant with MANIT pre-thesis submission guidelines.
GitHub Repository

title: Software Suite
text:
Contributing
These projects are open source and contributions are welcome. You can:

Report issues or suggest improvements on GitHub.
Submit pull requests with enhancements.
Fork and adapt templates for your institution’s requirements.
Share your use cases and feedback to help improve future releases.

Most projects are licensed under permissive open-source licenses (typically MIT or GPL) to ensure reusability and benefit to the wider research community.

title: Leveraging Text Data in Healthcare: A Systematic Review of AI-Driven Emotional Analysis and Patient-Centric Innovations
text: This systematic literature review (SLR) investigates how AI, deep learning (DL), and emotional analysis have been implemented/used in healthcare, and how they have influenced patient care and outcomes. AI techniques include methods of AI in diagnosis that have displayed undeniable promise in the areas of correct diagnosis, treatment plans that are individualized, and patient-therapist interaction. The review includes studies from 2014 to 2024, that explore the various sub-fields, including general healthcare, mental health, chronic disorders, and emergency care. It approves the main fields of deep learning techniques for sentiment analysis and emotion detection in healthcare and the high accuracy of the applications and other issues such as data quality, privacy concerns, model explainability, and assimilation into current healthcare systems. The study of emotional recognition is one such example of research that shows it is the application of AI models in emotional assessments done in real-time and detecting mental health conditions. Nevertheless, ethical and privacy issues are what make it difficult, thus, it is determined that proper consideration for data security and the public’s confidence in artificial intelligence are required to solve the issues. The study concludes that further research should be conducted in the fields of data quality improvement and AI model explainability development and that AI systems should be interoperable within healthcare infrastructures. Nevertheless, even though there are barriers, AI and emotional analysis gives healthcare the capability of new patient outcome improvements and even more personalized care.

title: Leveraging Text Data in Healthcare: A Systematic Review of AI-Driven Emotional Analysis and Patient-Centric Innovations
text: This systematic literature review (SLR) investigates how AI, deep learning (DL), and emotional analysis have been implemented/used in healthcare, and how they have influenced patient care and outcomes. AI techniques include methods of AI in diagnosis that have displayed undeniable promise in the areas of correct diagnosis, treatment plans that are individualized, and patient-therapist interaction. The review includes studies from 2014 to 2024, that explore the various sub-fields, including general healthcare, mental health, chronic disorders, and emergency care. It approves the main fields of deep learning techniques for sentiment analysis and emotion detection in healthcare and the high accuracy of the applications and other issues such as data quality, privacy concerns, model explainability, and assimilation into current healthcare systems. The study of emotional recognition is one such example of research that shows it is the application of AI models in emotional assessments done in real-time and detecting mental health conditions. Nevertheless, ethical and privacy issues are what make it difficult, thus, it is determined that proper consideration for data security and the public’s confidence in artificial intelligence are required to solve the issues. The study concludes that further research should be conducted in the fields of data quality improvement and AI model explainability development and that AI systems should be interoperable within healthcare infrastructures. Nevertheless, even though there are barriers, AI and emotional analysis gives healthcare the capability of new patient outcome improvements and even more personalized care.

title: Contextual BI-Directional Attention Flow With Embeddings From Language Models: A Generative Approach to Emotion Detection
text:
Abstract
Detection of Emotions from the text is a tedious task. Presently, existing models failed to detect the emotion in absence of the emotional word in the text. The cause phrase selection which gives a deep insight into emotions is considered to be a tough task. The proposed model for detecting emotions is developed through seven layers. Initially, the dataset is represented in the Topical documents using Adversarial Topic Modelling (ATM). Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) maps each phrase in the topical document to Higher-dimensional vectors, followed by the ELMo Model to obtain the fixed word Embeddings vectors. LSTM is responsible for making the interaction between the words in word embeddings and produces the context and query vectors. The bi-directional Attention flow layer determines the most relevant similarity between Context and Query. Finally, Robustly Optimized BERT (RoBERT) architecture is used to detect the Emotion. It is noted that the proposed multi-stage model detects better emotions than all the existing state-of-art models for detecting emotions.

title: Publications
text: My research spans artificial intelligence, deep learning, affective computing, and healthcare informatics. I study emotion detection and cognitive appraisal in text, and I focus on how AI systems interpret human emotions in real-world healthcare and human-centered contexts. I also work on explainable AI and dataset engineering, particularly developing structured emotion annotations and transparent evaluation methods.

title: Publications
text: Reviews

title: Enhancing Small Object Detection through Structure-Aware and Global Contextual Information
text: In the task of small object detection, limitations such as fewer pixels, lack of rich features, and difficulty in feature extraction often lead to issues like missed detections, false detections, and low accuracy in models. To address these issues, a small object detection algorithm based on multi-scale structure-aware and global context information is proposed. A multi-scale structure-aware module is designed for complex scenarios to better capture the detailed features of small objects, thereby enhancing the model’s ability to detect objects of different sizes. To obtain more global features, a global context information module is designed using the advantages of Transformers in capturing long-range dependency features, effectively establishing connections between pixel points in different regions. To address the gradient explosion phenomenon during model training, a new weighted loss function, W-FIoU, is designed, significantly improving the convergence speed during training. Extensive experimental results show that the proposed method achieves better detection results compared to other classic lightweight methods. Compared to the benchmark model, the proposed model improves mAP50 and mAP50:95 by 6.4 and 4.6 percentage points respectively on the VisDrone dataset, and also performs well on the TinyPerson dataset.

title: Enhancing Small Object Detection through Structure-Aware and Global Contextual Information
text: In the task of small object detection, limitations such as fewer pixels, lack of rich features, and difficulty in feature extraction often lead to issues like missed detections, false detections, and low accuracy in models. To address these issues, a small object detection algorithm based on multi-scale structure-aware and global context information is proposed. A multi-scale structure-aware module is designed for complex scenarios to better capture the detailed features of small objects, thereby enhancing the model’s ability to detect objects of different sizes. To obtain more global features, a global context information module is designed using the advantages of Transformers in capturing long-range dependency features, effectively establishing connections between pixel points in different regions. To address the gradient explosion phenomenon during model training, a new weighted loss function, W-FIoU, is designed, significantly improving the convergence speed during training. Extensive experimental results show that the proposed method achieves better detection results compared to other classic lightweight methods. Compared to the benchmark model, the proposed model improves mAP50 and mAP50:95 by 6.4 and 4.6 percentage points respectively on the VisDrone dataset, and also performs well on the TinyPerson dataset.

title: A Systematic Review of AI, Emotional Analysis, and Patient-Centric Applications in Healthcare
text: This systematic literature review investigates how AI, emotional analysis, and patient-centric applications have been implemented in healthcare. The review explores various AI techniques and their impact on patient care and clinical outcomes.

title: Text-based emotion recognition using contextual phrase embedding model
text: Comming soon

title: Text-based emotion recognition using contextual phrase embedding model
text: Comming soon

title: Text-based emotion recognition using contextual phrase embedding model
text:
Abstract
In this paper, the proposed approach categories the sentences in the dataset into the various topical documents using the TE-LSTM+SC model. As well as, the model generates semantic words related to topics that are fed into the word embedding like Skip-Gram and FrameNet to build the domain-specific lexicon. The topically related sentences in each document are contextually grouped using Skip-Phrase. Each sentence in contextual group is given to Semantic Role Labelling (SRL). SRL indentify the essential predicate-argument structures with the semantic labels like verb (V) tag or ARGM-NEG or ARGM-PRP or ARGM-CAU or structures with the semantic labels like verb (V) tag or ARGM-NEG or ARGM-PRP or ARGM-CAU or ARGM-MNR or ARGM-MOD. The selected predicateargument structures are aggregated into a linear layer to form a semantic embedding. Simultaneously, the predicate-argument embedding is segmented to sub words by BERT. The sub-words are transformed to word level through a convolutional layer to acquire the contextual word representation. Finally, semantic embedding and word representation are integrated to efficiently find the emotion of the given sentence. The experimental result proved that the proposed approach outperforms all the state-of-art approaches.

title: Expanding AI’s Role in Healthcare Applications: A Systematic Review of Emotional and Cognitive Analysis Techniques
text: This systematic literature review (SLR) analyzes the various applications of artificial intelligence (AI) in healthcare, with a particular emphasis on the integration of emotive and cognitive analytical frameworks. The primary aim of this investigation is to thoroughly evaluate the influence of AI technology on patient care by analyzing emotional processes and enabling patient-centered solutions. In this research, we investigate the cognitive and emotional approaches to sentiment analysis and other modeling and forecasting methods using AI. Primary sources include patients’ reviews, online health exchanges and doctors’ narratives. Key aspects of the present state of affairs are advances in the development of machine learning algorithms for emotion recognition, intracellular fusion of cognitive and affective modes of analysis, and the application of artificial intelligence for the enhancement of clinical support systems. Moreover, these technologies have significantly improved individualized clinical approaches, expedited the early identification of mental health problems, and strengthened the rationale for therapeutic treatments. Despite recent advancements, the discipline still faces numerous persistent obstacles. Pressing issues include the ethical implications of using artificial intelligence, the need to protect patient privacy, and the complexity of detecting biases in algorithms. Nevertheless, the impact of AI on healthcare practices is indisputable, indicating a future marked by a more intelligent, efficient, empathetic, and patient-centered healthcare system.
